solution_line_template: He needs {total_flour_needed} pounds of flour because {num_loaves} x {flour_per_loaf} = <<{num_loaves}*{flour_per_loaf}={total_flour_needed}>>{total_flour_needed}

He needs {num_bags_10lb_exact} bags of {flour_bag_size_10lb} pound bags because {total_flour_needed} / {flour_bag_size_10lb} = <<{total_flour_needed}/{flour_bag_size_10lb}={num_bags_10lb_exact}>>{num_bags_10lb_exact}
He therefore needs to buy {num_bags_10lb_actual} bags of flour because {lower_bound_10lb_bags} < {num_bags_10lb_exact} < {num_bags_10lb_actual}
He spends ${cost_for_10lb_bags} if he buys this flour because {num_bags_10lb_actual} x {cost_10lb_bag} = <<{num_bags_10lb_actual}*{cost_10lb_bag}={cost_for_10lb_bags}>>{cost_for_10lb_bags}

He needs {num_bags_12lb_exact} bags of the {flour_bag_size_12lb}-pound flour because {total_flour_needed} / {flour_bag_size_12lb} = <<{total_flour_needed}/{flour_bag_size_12lb}={num_bags_12lb_exact}>>{num_bags_12lb_exact}
He would spend ${cost_for_12lb_bags} on the {flour_bag_size_12lb}-pound bags because {num_bags_12lb_exact} x {cost_12lb_bag} = {cost_for_12lb_bags}
He spends ${cheapest_cost} if he buys the cheapest flour because {cost_for_10lb_bags} < {cost_for_12lb_bags}
